Articles.Content:
A new addition to KSP recently has been that KSP will now tell you if a craft has unknown modules in the craft file. Which makes sense to some but for me, I change mods frequently and copy saves from install to install and not all of them can have the same mods. Some are outdated and some are not longer supported at all. 

Mostly I’d just like a means to disable these messages when I load a craft. It just slows me down.
Ignore them. It's an extra click, and the warning is there for a reason

13 minutes ago, linuxgurugamer said:

Ignore them. It's an extra click, and the warning is there for a reason

Then why isn’t other warnings like the ‘Do not time warp with big ships’ not disablable? As you said, it’s one click. It’s there for a reason. 

Personally I don’t need to be warned that a KAS module isn’t loaded when KAS isn’t installed and wasn’t even used on the vessel and changes nothing about the vessel but because it’s auto generated with the mod installed, it’s extra work
